data.title: Refresh folder button won't work

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.0
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open some folder in VSCode
2. Create some file in this folder outside of VSCode (i.e. with Windows Explorer)
3. Hit refresh button.

You won't see this new file until you restart VSCode.

data.title: open with visual studio code , opens the file minimized
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.0
- OS Version: windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. open instance of the application
2. minimize it 
3. go to any text file , right click -> open with visual studio code 
4. it will opened minimized

data.title: Windows Installer has two times a checkbox to launch after installation
data.body:
The first one is "Launch Code after installation" somewhere before the installation begins
The second one is after the installation and reads "Launch Visual Studio Code - Insiders"

data.title: Associate custom shortcuts to custom tasks not yet possible.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.0
- OS Version: Win 10 64 bit

Steps to Reproduce:
1. crate a new task named "myTask"
2. add a shortcut like this: { "key": "ctrl+shift+b", "command": "workbench.action.tasks.myTask" }

The command associated to the shortcut isn't recognized.

data.title: editor.wordBasedSuggestions shows up last in default settings?
data.body:
I would expect settings to be grouped together but `editor.wordBasedSuggestions` shows up last:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/15921591/be7815da-2e22-11e6-8d2e-4c20119c7623.png)

data.title: Runaway terminalProcess processes
data.body:
These processes linger around long after I shutdown Code:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/15921488/229a06c8-2e22-11e6-82a9-7bbec9ea3330.png)

We usually [detect whether the parent process is dead](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/code/node/sharedProcessMain.ts#L31) to suicide a process.

data.title: Better handling of markers from temporary or in memory files
data.body:
I think the editor does not show problems in non file resources but the problems view does. In this case there is a warning in the default settings file (readonly) and the problems view shows the warning but the editor does not:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/15921485/1da85250-2e22-11e6-9717-b36b7a833b8c.png)

data.title: Terminal not cleared when re-opened after 'clear'
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.0
- OS Version: OS X 10.11.4

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open integrated terminal
2. Run some commands
3. Run `clear`
4. Close terminal
5. Re-open terminal

Here's a link to a video demonstrating the bug: [https://gfycat.com/LargeMilkyBuck](https://gfycat.com/LargeMilkyBuck)

data.title: Monaco Hover API : trims text leaving dangling `:`
data.body:
Sample : 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/874898/15921170/f1da1460-2e62-11e6-86e5-f96b0e1f44c2.png)

I sent it the complete `name` (i.e. `(parameter) props: AvatarProps`) but it trimmed out the type name leaving a dangling `:` at the end. 

I'd rather it not eat anything ever, even in this case: 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/874898/15921211/49e02a0a-2e63-11e6-860a-0eabcaac187c.png)

Again thanks for making it all OSS my journey continues https://github.com/alm-tools/alm/pull/121 :rose:

data.title: Monaco API request : allow html content renderer to accept raw innerHtml
data.body:
This file : https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/5cd6e6edb3e027b8ade2d888d4e457b2256d50fd/src/vs/base/browser/htmlContentRenderer.ts

E.g. it is used in information on hover. For [alm.tools](http://alm.tools/) I have my own `toHtml` function: https://github.com/alm-tools/alm/blob/5fef6d6b0f52ae08b52cea23241ed2d5f56d7236/src/app/markdown/markdown.tsx#L31-L44 (its worked for me `¯\_(ツ)_/¯`) that I'd like to continue to use. 

If you want feel free to call it `dangerouslySetInnerHtml` (https://facebook.github.io/react/tips/dangerously-set-inner-html.html). Would help with the migration https://github.com/alm-tools/alm/pull/121 :rose:
### More reasons

_PS the built in `markdown` support in the standalone editor doesn't work_

Exhibit : 

my code 
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/874898/15921045/025c01d2-2e62-11e6-8199-d00c3e96b82f.png)
usage: 
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/874898/15921072/292fcb18-2e62-11e6-9649-ac8d6798c0a5.png)
I get the stars: 
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/874898/15921076/2eb6221c-2e62-11e6-94e9-f8b1143967ea.png)

_I really like github style code blocks_ 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/874898/15921110/70ce0732-2e62-11e6-9716-97593c299651.png)

data.title: vs/code should only have one dependency to vs/workbench
data.body:
And that is for the index.html file it loads. Currently it depends on:
- `vs/workbench/node/userSettings` which should probably move to vs/base
- `vs/workbench/parts/git` for the password prompt

data.title: Clean file from Git view not reload it in file view

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Version `0.10.10`
                             Commit 5b5f4db87c10345b9d5c8d0bed745bcad4533135
- OS Version: `Linux 3.16.0-4-amd64 #1 SMP Debian 3.16.7-ckt20-1+deb8u3 (2016-01-17) x86_64 GNU/Linux`

When a versioned file is **deleted** from ui, then clean from **Git view**, it's doesn't show up in **File view**.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Delete a versioned file 
2. Clean it from Git view
3. The file doesn't come up in the file view

data.title: Intellisense on nodejs app files with no extension
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.0
- OS Version: CentOS 7 -- NodeJS app

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  Use express-generator to create a nodejs app; it creates a bin/www file with no extension
2.  When editing the bin/www file, with language mode as JavaScript, the require, process, etc. entries are indicated as errors.
3.  If a .js extension is added to the bin/www file - the intellisense no longer shows the entries as errors

A bit strange (at least from my perspective) as one would think that intellisense would be driven from the Language Mode not the extension, or lack thereof. "Normal" javascript intellisense is active BTW, it just seems to not be picking up the nodejs references.

Really like VSCode, VS Community just seems "too heavy" for a lot of small-medium projects.

Thanks,
David

![screenshot from 2016-06-09 00-46-02](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2047925/15915910/e3c364ca-2ddc-11e6-83c6-101a1099c9a2.png)

data.title: Monaco API : OverviewRulerLane is only two lanes (instead of three)
data.body: The type definition is : ``` ts export enum OverviewRulerLane { Left = 1, Center = 2, Right = 4, Full = 7, } ``` However there only seems to be two lanes functional: Compare this to vscode where we actually have three lanes: Would really like to get three lanes in standalone editor as well (which I plan to use for git, find results, errors) :rose: refs [alm.tools](http://alm.tools/) move to monaco https://github.com/alm-tools/alm/pull/121

data.title: Terminal instantly closes
data.body:
- VSCode Version: both 1.2.0 and latest insiders
- OS Version: Windows 10, latest updates

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Try to open terminal (both ctrl+` and view -> ...)

It just shows terminal for a brief moment (few miliseconds) and then it closes.
I'm (sometimes, not everytime I try to open it) getting error "write EPIPE".
(this might be cause by holding the key binding button).

I dont have anything else bound to ctrl + `.
Tried restarting, reinstalling, restarting PC.
Tried using both powershell and cmd. (as described in your post).

Thank you for looking at this isuue. (or possibly telling me what am I doing wrong).

data.title: VS Code doesn't start on Mac OS El Capitan
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2
- OS Version:10.11.4

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Installed VS Code following instruction
2. Double click on the icon

I then see only one menu Code with Quit in it. Nothings happens more.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2274006/15912678/0a4fedcc-2dd6-11e6-9c5d-8c69896fe3d7.png)

Later update. If I start atom after having launched VSCode , then VSCode starts correctly at the same time and opens the main window. Quite strange.

data.title: when a task started using visual studio code tasks , environment variables aren't working
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.2.0
- OS Version: ubuntu 15.10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. create gulp tasks
2. user exec in a task and set env option to exec as process.env
3. run the task by issuing gulp command from terminal (it works)
4. run task from visual studio interface by using shortcut key (environment variables are not set !!!)

data.title: Question / Request: Shortcut to expand multi-cursors to word boundaries
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.0-insider
- OS Version: Windows 8 x64

Question: Is there a way to expand multi cursors to select each current word, even when the words aren't the same?

Here is an example of attempting to convert javascript object notation to properly quoted JSON, using multicursor support and the ctrl+d shortcut.

Functionality in Sublime (middleclick+drag, ctrl+d):
![2016-06-07t09_09_14-multiselect_word_boundaries](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4721566/15910086/36a7e558-2d7e-11e6-94c9-c93417c97b2b.gif)

Functionality in VSCode (leftclick, shift+alt+leftclick+drag, ctrl+d):
![2016-06-07t09_09_14-multiselect_word_boundaries-vscode](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4721566/15910108/5473fb9e-2d7e-11e6-8e57-92a8664a853c.gif)

Is there a shortcut / function that I'm missing which will expand all cursors to their respective boundaries? I know I can _technically_ get the same functionality through usage of ctrl+arrow key to get to the beginning or end of a boundary (where necessary) followed by shift+ctrl+arrow key in the opposite direction, but I've done it with a single shortcut for so long that the habit may be difficult to break.

data.title: Lost highlighting syntax with typescript
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.0
- OS Version: Microsoft Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Go to [https://www.typescriptlang.org/play/index.html](https://www.typescriptlang.org/play/index.html)
2. Copy the code of "Building a Raytracer" and paste in Visual Studio Code
3. See how after the line 261 VSCode lost the highlighting syntax with the operator `<=`

![2016-06-08](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4933682/15910103/72f4585c-2d97-11e6-9f64-90a3d105650a.png)

data.title: Debug adapters should get the current open folder
data.body: I think there used to be a 'cwd' property automatically sent over set to the current directory. Why was it removed? I'd like to make my launch config simpler by globbing for files inside the user's open folder.

data.title: Colons in SASS maps marked as error
data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.2.0 + 1.3.0-insiders - OS Version: MacOS X 10.11.5 Steps to Reproduce: 1. Open/create scss file 2. Write a map, the first colon is marked as an error 3. Error message: `") expected"` Code from screenshot: ``` scss // Breakpoints $breakpoints: ( 'xsmall': 21.25rem, // 340px 'small': 40rem, // 640px 'medium': 48rem, // 768px 'large': 61.25rem, // 980px 'xlarge': 82rem // 1312px ); ```
